titlestmt.subtitle:
An inventory of
the collection at Syracuse University
titlestmt.author: [Summit record]

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Collection contains scripts written by Seaman Jacobs for television comedy shows. Extent of coverage varies.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Seaman Jacobs was a comedy writer for such productions as "The Joey Bishop Show," "Hereâ€™s Lucy," and several Bob Hope television specials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Seaman Jacobs Scripts contains scripts for television shows for which Jacobs was the author. Television shows are primarily comedy shows or situation comedies; shows represented include The Red Skelton Show, Bob Hope, Here's Lucy, No Time For Sergeants, Bachelor Father, F-Troop, The Real McCoy's, The Jimmy Stewart Show, and How to Marry a Millionaire.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Scripts are arranged in no particular order by title of show, and within that by episode air date. The catalog number for each episode is given in parentheses ( ).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has a number of television-related collections. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete listing

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Materials do not circulate and no copies may be made without permission of the rights holder(s). Literary rights, including copyright may belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:
